result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Patrick E. McGaw was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Patrick E. McGaw in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    State recites joint recommendation: Ct 2 - dismissed.  Ct 1 - W/H 3 yrs probation - 6 mo jail w/ Huber, no objection to electronic monitoring if available and no objection to transfer to Dane County if allowed, $2122.00,  $40.50, 24 mo DLR, 24 mo IID upon legal licensure, AODA & dsp, DNA submission.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.    Defendant sworn by the Clerk.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
